item.title: 卢特尼克家族的 BGC 集团以 3.25 亿美元收购经纪公司 OTC
item.description: 亿万富翁卢特尼克家族控制的金融公司 BGC Group Inc. 以 3.25 亿美元现金收购了经纪公司 OTC Global Holdings，以扩大其在能源和大宗商品领域的业务。【原文：BGC Group Inc., a financial firm controlled by the billionaire Lutnick family, bought brokerage OTC Global Holdings for $325 million in cash to expand its presence in energy and commodities.】

item.title: 阿波罗为私人投资者提供费用奖励以锁定资本
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：Apollo Global Management Inc. is trying to woo wealthy investors to one of its newest private market funds and keep them there with a rare offer — a bonus if they stick around for three years.】

item.title: 盖蒂博物馆为防火出售 5 亿美元债务
item.description: 加州最著名的艺术机构之一盖蒂美术馆正在向债券市场寻求 5 亿美元的资金，以帮助保护其杰作，因为加州正准备迎接又一个火灾频发的夏季。【原文：One of California’s most famed art institutions, the Getty, is turning to the bond market for $500 million to help preserve its masterpieces as the state prepares for another fire-prone summer.】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行任命花旗银行的 Jurd 为欧洲工业业务主管
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，加拿大皇家银行已聘请花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Royal Bank of Canada has hired longtime Citigroup Inc. dealmaker Rob Jurd as its head of industrial investment banking in Europe, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新日铁和激进派竞购卢特尼克美国钢铁公司
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）已成为决定美国钢铁公司未来的关键人物，上周他连续与竞购美国钢铁公司的竞争对手举行会谈。【原文：US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has emerged as a key player in determining the future of United States Steel Corp., holding back-to-back meetings with rival bidders for the American steelmaker last week.】

item.title: 纽约市审计长称，马斯克的 DOGE 工作损害了特斯拉股东的利益
item.description: 纽约市主计长布拉德-兰德（Brad Lander）是纽约市五家养老基金的投资顾问，他指责特斯拉公司歪曲了首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在该公司的参与情况。【原文：New York City Comptroller Brad Lander, the investment adviser to the city’s five pension funds, accused Tesla Inc. of misrepresenting chief executive officer Elon Musk’s involvement in the company.】

item.title: 巴克莱重聘德意志银行肖特为西海岸赞助商
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）重新聘用了德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）董事总经理杰森-肖特（Jason Short），负责西海岸的金融赞助商，这家英国银行旨在加强其投资银行业务。【原文：Barclays Plc has rehired Deutsche Bank AG managing director Jason Short to cover West Coast-based financial sponsors as the British bank aims to bolster its investment banking efforts.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行获得加拿大银行执照，进军美洲市场
item.description: 桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）获得了加拿大银行执照，继续向美洲扩张。【原文：Banco Santander SA has won a Canadian banking license as it continues its expansion across the Americas.】

item.description:

item.title: 策略师下调 S&P 500 预测，但仍预计会反弹
item.description: 华尔街三位最可靠的牛市人士承认，他们对今年 S&P 500 指数的预期过于乐观，但他们仍然相信股市将在 2025 年剩余的三个季度中反弹。【原文：Three of Wall Street’s most reliable bulls have acknowledged that they were too optimistic in their estimates for the S&P 500 Index this year — but they still believe stocks will rally over the remaining three quarters of 2025.】

item.title: 如果美国设定中国船舶收费标准，Genco 将转移船只并转嫁成本
item.description: 这家美国最大的干散货托运人表示，如果美国对中国船只征收费用的建议生效，它准备将成本转嫁给美国出口商，或将船只停泊在其他地方。【原文：The largest US-based dry bulk shipper said it is prepared to pass on costs to US exporters or position its ships elsewhere if proposed US fees on Chinese ships go into place.】

item.title: 加州对加拿大石油的渴求引发西海岸石油进口热潮
item.description: 美国西海岸炼油厂上个月进口了创纪录数量的加拿大石油，因为关税威胁和竞争等级石油的高价促使买家囤积重质高硫原油。【原文：US West Coast refiners imported a record amount of Canadian oil last month as the threat of tariffs and high prices for competing grades prompted buyers to stock up on the heavy, high-sulfur crude.】

item.title: 摩根大通为陷入困境的 Chuck E. Cheese 债券开出更优惠的条件
item.description: 据知情人士透露，摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is discussing a bigger yield and other possible investor-friendly changes to the $660 million junk-bond offering for Chuck E. Cheese owner CEC Entertainment that has struggled to attract demand, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 任天堂股票估值飙升，Switch 2 利益攸关
item.description: 任天堂公司（Nintendo Co., Ltd.）的股价因对 Switch 2 游戏机的期待而飙升，创下了一系列纪录，这使得即将揭晓的这款小工具的细节成为一个潜在的分水岭。【原文：Nintendo Co. shares have soared to a series of records in anticipation of its Switch 2 console, making the upcoming reveal of the gadget’s details a potential watershed.】

item.title: 欧佩克在计划恢复供应前减少石油产量
item.description: 欧佩克上个月减少了原油产量，尼日利亚和伊拉克的原油产量受到抑制，之后该组织开始实施拖延已久的恢复停产计划。【原文：OPEC reduced crude oil production last month, with curbs in Nigeria and Iraq, before the group proceeds with long-delayed plans to revive halted output.】

item.title: 混合攻击事件后，英国收紧了针对俄罗斯特工的规定
item.description: 英国将俄罗斯列入其新的外国影响力登记计划的最高级别，这意味着任何在英国为俄罗斯国家工作的人都需要申报他们的活动，否则将面临牢狱之灾。【原文：The UK put Russia in the top tier of its new Foreign Influence Registration Scheme, meaning anyone working for the Russian state in Britain will need to declare their activity or face jail.】

item.title: 市场人士对全球首只巨灾债券 ETF 望而却步
item.description: 从加密货币到抵押贷款义务，美国 ETF 市场努力拥抱的资产并不多。但是，这个价值 10 万亿美元的行业可能已经找到了华尔街最新到来的资产的极限。【原文：From cryptocurrencies to collateralized loan obligations, there aren’t many assets the US ETF market has struggled to embrace. But the $10 trillion industry may have found its limit with Wall Street’s newest arrival.】

item.title: 面对马斯克的反击和海外交付困境，特斯拉将公布销售情况
item.description: 随着展厅遭到破坏、生产线停工、海外销售下滑，特斯拉公司在 2025 年经历了一个残酷的开端。这家汽车制造商即将揭示它有多艰难。【原文：With its showrooms vandalized, production lines paused and sales tanking overseas, Tesla Inc. has had a brutal start to 2025. The automaker is about the reveal just how rough it was.】

item.title: 汽车制造商面临 25% 关税打击，南非寻求与美国谈判
item.description: 本周，美国将对南非汽车业征收新的关税，南非贸易部将寻求与美国进行谈判，并表示这些关税可能会损害当地制造商和经济。【原文：South Africa’s trade ministry will seek talks with the US as its auto industry braces for a hit from Washington’s new tariffs this week, saying the duties could hurt local manufacturers and the economy.】

item.title: 经济衰退煤矿中的信贷金丝雀摇摇欲坠

item.title: 尽管有金属交易，贸易战仍削弱了加拿大股票销售市场
item.description: 第一季度，尽管贵金属交易活跃，但与美国的贸易紧张局势造成的波动仍抑制了加拿大的股票交易市场。【原文：Volatility from trade tensions with the US kept a lid on Canada’s market for equity deals in the first quarter, even as activity in precious metals perked up.】

item.title: LME 因 2022 年发生的事故对储存假镍的仓库处以罚款
item.description: 伦敦金属交易所对仓库运营商 Access World 处以 60,000 英镑（77,316 美元）的罚款，原因是该公司于 2022 年从鹿特丹的一个仓库错误地装载出镍，而在此之前五个月，该公司为客户持有的部分金属被发现是假的。【原文：The London Metal Exchange has fined warehouse operator Access World £60,000 ($77,316) for erroneously loading out nickel from a depot in Rotterdam in 2022, five months before the discovery that some of the metal it was holding for clients was fake.】

item.title: 关税构成威胁，美国乳业未来依赖出口
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战正威胁着美国的乳制品出口，而乳制品行业正需要新的市场来满足其蓬勃发展的生产需求。【原文：President Donald Trump’s trade war is threatening US dairy exports just as the industry needs new markets for its booming production.】

item.title: 因评级下调和丰富的 NHL 电视交易，罗杰斯跌至 2012 年以来最低点
item.description: 据《Sportico》报道，加拿大顶级无线公司罗杰斯通信公司（Rogers Communications Inc.股价下跌。【原文：Rogers Communications Inc., Canada’s top wireless firm, is set to renew its 12-year broadcast deal with the National Hockey League for C$11 billion ($7.7 billion), according to a report in Sportico. The shares dropped.】

item.title: 美联储主席巴金称关税可能会减少就业并加剧通胀
item.description: 里士满联邦储备银行行长汤姆-巴金（Tom Barkin）表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税可能会同时提高通胀率和失业率，给央行带来巨大挑战。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond President Tom Barkin said President Donald Trump’s tariffs could raise both inflation and unemployment, creating a big challenge for the central bank.】

item.title: 秘鲁 3 月通胀率降至 1.28% 低于预期
item.description: 秘鲁首都 3 月份的通胀放缓幅度低于预期，符合央行关于消费者价格上涨步伐可能在年底加快的预期。【原文：Inflation in Peru’s capital slowed less than expected in March, in line with central bank expectations that the pace of consumer price increases will likely quicken toward year-end.】

item.title: 据说 Cellnex 将启动价值 20 亿欧元的瑞士业务出售计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Cellnex Telecom SA 已开始出售其瑞士业务的多数股权，出售价格可能高达 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元）。【原文：Cellnex Telecom SA has kicked off a sale of its majority stake in its Swiss business, which could fetch as much as €2 billion ($2.2 billion), according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街收税预估暗示流动性枯竭
item.description: 华尔街策略师预计，去年金融市场的涨势将推动美国政府迎来一个强劲的纳税季，就在政客们为债务上限问题争得面红耳赤之际，可能会导致流动性减少。【原文：Wall Street strategists expect last year’s financial market gains to fuel a robust tax season for the US government, potentially leading to a drawdown of liquidity just as politicians wrestle over the debt ceiling.】

item.title: Roblox 与谷歌合作提供游戏内广告服务
item.description: Roblox 公司正在与 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌公司合作，提供鼓励玩家参与的广告，这标志着该视频游戏平台在推动从广告中获得更多收入方面迈出了重要一步。【原文：Roblox Corp. is partnering with Alphabet Inc.’s Google to offer ads that encourage player engagement, marking a significant step in the video-game platform’s push to generate more revenue from advertising.】

item.title: 美国劳动力市场放缓，职位空缺减少，裁员人数不变
item.description: 美国 2 月份的职位空缺有所减少，而裁员情况依然低迷，这进一步证明劳动力市场只是在逐渐降温。【原文：US job openings fell in February while layoffs remained subdued, adding to evidence of a labor market that’s only gradually cooling.】
